title: Principal Product Designer - Future Experiences
description: Upwork ($UPWK) is the world‚Äôs work marketplace. We serve everyone from one-person startups to large, Fortune 100 enterprises with a powerful, trust-driven platform that enables companies and talent to work together in new ways that unlock their potential.Last year, more than $3.8 billion of work was done through Upwork by skilled professionals who are gaining more control by finding work they are passionate about and innovating their careers.This role will work with a team that looks to transform how people work by leveraging AI. In the past few years we have seen great change in the ways we work and we are experiencing an acceleration in AI. This is an opportunity to work at the forefront and intersection of AI and the future of work. One of the key design opportunities will be crafting an AI native product experience. As such, we are looking for a Principal Product Designer who is comfortable with ambiguity, passionate about creating something from the ground up, has exceptional entrepreneurial skills and loves solving customer problems and exploring new ways to serve Upwork‚Äôs clients and freelancers. Your Responsibilities: Develop a deep understanding of Upwork‚Äôs customers, product, business, and competitive landscape to identify new areas for exploration. Work with Product and UXR to generate a backlog of ideas that are aligned with Upwork‚Äôs goals and customer needs. Support multiple work streams and different initiatives at once, while connecting dots across all product experiences. Create user flows, wireframes, and high fidelity prototypes. Design within existing, and help to create new, design standards to contribute to our design systems. Partner closely with engineering colleagues to better understand and help push our technology current and future. Incubate promising ideas to achieve product-market fit. Collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to ensure that Upwork Labs‚Äô products and initiatives are aligned with the broader company strategy and vision. Collaborate with technology, product, and business teams to uncover customer and business needs - then translating them into intuitive and engaging digital experiences Participate in translating complex ideas into understandable concepts that evolve and enhance the product experience Manage through shifting priorities to provide clear direction and input on product prioritization and support early product definition Work with partners and teams across various geographies Support effective storytelling and presentation of visual concepts to various stakeholders What it Takes to Catch our Eye: You have experience building products around emerging technologies. Examples: AR/VR, Alexa, AI, Interfaceless Design, wearables, Google Spotlight, etc. You think beyond traditional Product Design experiences/screens and have experience with conversational UX/Ui. You are curious about haptics, and new ways of designing as it pertains to AI and beyond. You have numerous design tricks and solutions in your arsenal and can quickly see a variety of solutions to a problem. In addition to being a great UX designer you have a portfolio of work that demonstrates excellent visual design skills. You like rapid environments and building great experiences around business intent and customer insights. You thrive in a feedback focused environment and seek input from stakeholders and teammates early and often. You efficiently manage your time, quickly switch context, juggle multiple projects and consistently communicate progress with your manager and the team You thrive in a changing environment and have a process, but are not afraid to throw it out or modify it as needed. You are a storyteller and can weave and share compelling narratives around research findings and design concepts. You gather and integrate feedback, influence stakeholders and create energy for ideas or initiative. Information Architecture experience is a plus. The annual base salary for this position in California and Washington ranges from $170,000 - $230,000. The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum salary for this position in California and Washington, and individual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Additionally, this position is eligible for the annual bonus plan or sales incentive plan and eligibility to participate in our long term equity incentive programCome change how the world works.At Upwork, you‚Äôll shape talent solutions for how the world works today. We are a remote-first organization working together to create exciting remote work opportunities for a global community of professionals. While we have physical offices in San Francisco and Chicago, currently we also support hiring of corporate full-time employees in 19 states in the United States. Please speak with a member of our recruitment team to determine whether you are located in a state in which we are hiring corporate full-time employees. At the core of our vibrant culture are shared values that form the foundation of our organization. These values revolve around trust, risk-taking, customer focus, and excellence. Our overarching mission is to create economic opportunities so that people have better lives. We foster an environment where individuals are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, nurturing personal and professional growth through development opportunities, mentorship programs, and participation in Upwork Belonging Communities.We take pride in providing exceptional benefits to our employees. These include comprehensive medical insurance coverage for both you and your family, unlimited paid time off, a 401(k) plan with matching contributions, 12 weeks of paid parental leave, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan. To explore these benefits in detail, as well as gain insights into our company values, working principles, and the overall employee experience, we invite you to visit our Life at Upwork page.Upwork is proudly committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and inclusive workforce. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.To learn more about how Upwork processes and protects your personal information as part of the application process, please review our Global Job Applicant Privacy Notice

title: Vice President of Product
description: Position Overview:We are seeking a highly skilled and visionary Part-Time Vice President of Product. As the Vice President of Product, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing product strategy, overseeing product development processes, and driving innovation. This part-time position offers flexible hours and requires a deep understanding of product management, strong leadership abilities, and a passion for delivering exceptional user experiences.Responsibilities: Product Strategy and Vision: Collaborate with the executive team to define the product vision, strategy, and roadmap that aligns with the companys overall goals and objectives. Identify market opportunities, conduct customer research, and leverage data insights to inform product decision-making. Product Development and Lifecycle Management: Lead the end-to-end product development process, from concept to launch and beyond. Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, and marketing, to deliver high-quality products on time and within budget. Manage product lifecycles, including enhancements, updates, and retirements. User-Centric Design: Advocate for user-centric design principles and ensure a deep understanding of customer needs and pain points. Drive the development of intuitive, engaging, and innovative product experiences that delight users and differentiate our offerings in the market. Product Roadmap and Prioritization: Develop and communicate a comprehensive product roadmap that aligns with business objectives and customer needs. Prioritize feature development, balancing short-term and long-term goals, customer feedback, market trends, and technical feasibility. Market and Competitive Analysis: Stay abreast of market trends, competitor activities, and emerging technologies in the industry. Conduct market and competitive analysis to identify opportunities and address gaps. Use insights to refine product strategies and make informed decisions. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate closely with engineering, design, marketing, and sales teams to ensure alignment and effective coordination throughout the product development lifecycle. Foster a collaborative and innovative culture that encourages teamwork and creativity. Performance Monitoring and Optimization: Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track product performance. Monitor product adoption, user engagement, and customer feedback to identify areas for improvement and drive iterative enhancements. Implement data-driven decision-making processes. Product Evangelism and Training: Act as a product evangelist both internally and externally. Develop and deliver product training sessions to internal teams, sales teams, and key stakeholders. Participate in industry events, conferences, and speaking engagements to showcase our products and thought leadership. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in business, computer science, engineering, or a related field. Advanced degree is a plus. Proven track record of success in product management or related roles, with experience leading product development from concept to launch. Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills, with the ability to translate market insights and customer needs into product strategies and roadmaps. Excellent leadership and team management abilities, with a track record of building and motivating high-performing teams. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization. Deep understanding of user-centered design principles, user experience (UX) best practices, and agile development methodologies. Strong business acumen and market awareness, with a passion for innovation and emerging technologies. Experience in conducting market research, competitive analysis, and customer research to inform product decision-making. Proficiency in product management tools and software, as well as project management and collaboration tools. As a part-time Vice President of Product, you will have the opportunity to drive product innovation, shape the customer experience, and contribute to the companys growth. If you are a visionary product leader with a passion for delivering exceptional products, we encourage you to apply.

title: Business Operations & Strategy Lead
description: Headway is building a new mental healthcare system that everyone can access. We make it easy for people to find quality in-network mental health care by removing historic barriers faced by mental health providers, payers, and patients. 1 in 4 people in the US have a treatable mental health condition, but the vast majority do not get the care they need. The primary reason is cost: the majority of therapists do not accept insurance, meaning paying for therapy is prohibitively expensive for prospective patients. This is where we got our start ‚Äì Headway has built the first software-enabled network of therapists who accept health insurance, making it easy for therapists to grow their practices, and possible for patients to find quality care they can afford. We launched in April of 2019 and are now powering 400,000+ appointments per month. To scale our vision, we‚Äôve raised over $100 million in funding from a16z, Thrive, Accel, and Google Ventures. Join us, and make an impact About The RoleOn the Business Operations Strategy team, our mission is simple: to drive mission critical outcomes in parts of the organization where we arent yet structured to invest, and to cultivate world-class entrepreneurial leaders who will effect change at Headway and beyond.As Headway grows, so do the complexity and impact of the challenges we face. The BizOps team deploys across the org to own company defining problems and to incubate trajectory-changing bets that we need to, but are not yet structured to tackle. To be a part of BizOps is to make a commitment to a tightly-knit community of peers who are intensely ambitious and introspective, and invest in one another to become the world-class entrepreneurial leaders of tomorrow.By design, this role will thrust you into the fire. If you aspire to build great things and seek the ambiguity and discomfort that growth necessitates, we‚Äôd love to talk with you.You will: Partner with functional teams across the org to diagnose complex problems and own outcomes from start to finish Spearhead new company bets, with potential to become new lines of business Collaborate with your fellow BizOps Leads to circulate best practices, distill novel opportunities, and support the evolution of the broader Headway org You‚Äôd be a great fit if... You have 5+ years of experience in a role that requires analytical problem solving, operational rigor, and outcome ownership. You have been a founder/early-stage employee of a fast-growing startup, and/or have been a core member of a 0 - 1 business line at a high-performing organization Data is your first-language; you enjoy and are skilled at digging through complex data to solve ambiguous problems You thrive in the unknown, and seek out opportunities to dive into unfamiliar challenges, roll up your sleeves, learn new skills, and drive towards solutions You are adept at distilling and communicating complex technical concepts to a broad, diverse audience You seek an environment that fosters individual growth through open, impactful feedback and high autonomy You are motivated by the opportunity to make an impact on one of our generation‚Äôs defining problems: affordable mental healthcare We believe a teams strength is in its people, and we cannot achieve this mission without a team that reflects the diversity of this problem - across race, ethnicity, gender, sexuality, age, national origin, religion, family status, disability, military status, and experience. Headway employees work remotely across the US, with the option to work from our NYC HQ. Headway is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Headway will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact email protected

title: Staff Software Engineer - AMO
description: Hiring Ranges:US Tier 1 Locations: $163,000 USD - $239,000 USDUS Tier 2 Locations: $150,000 USD - $220,000 USDUS Tier 3 Locations: $138,000 USD - $203,000 USDTo learn more about our Hiring Range System, please click this link.The RoleJoin the team at Mozilla responsible for building and maintaining the most powerful browser extensibility development ecosystem that empowers Firefox users to customize their browsing experience safely. Shape the future of web extensions by contributing to the design of the user journey from searching, selecting, and installing a web extension. Influence the operational support and the ecosystems security by implementing innovative automated solutions.Our ecosystem needs to handle information at a massive scale and extend well beyond searching a web extension. Were looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design, and mobile; the list continues growing every day.Join a distributed team of talented and diverse engineers working to maintain, secure and grow the Firefox add-ons ecosystem!What is a Staff Software Engineer at Mozilla?A Staff Software Engineer is the next level from a Senior Software Engineer. At Mozilla this role can vary but typically a Staff Engineer is a domain expert who leads others within a single team to tackle multi-month projects. Tasks that may be initially ambiguous or require significant planning and require them to influence or direct the work of several engineers. They sequence deliverables and manage risks in their teams projects, provide feedback on our strategy and goals affecting the team, and turn our strategy into action for their team members. Staff Software Engineers mentor others by stewarding some responsibilities to more junior and senior engineers so they can take on new ones. They collaborate with management on building team consensus and providing direction. Staff Software Engineers identify gaps and opportunities for improvement to enable a culture of inclusion and allyship, at all levels of the organization.Responsibilities The Staff Software Engineer, Full Stack is responsible for planning, architecting, and delivering major frontend and full stack software components within addons.mozilla.org (‚ÄúAMO‚Äù) Write and test product or system development code Lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency) Contribute to existing documentation and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality Collaborate with Mozillians across Product, UX, Design, Engineering, QA, Localization, Ops, and Legal to build, maintain, and expand core features Write unit tests, automated regression tests, and track defects as they occur. Build performant, decoupled, testable, and maintainable code What You Bring 7+ years of software engineering experience and a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or Engineering or its equivalent work experience 4+ years of experience using JavaScript, React/Redux Experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms Experience testing, maintaining, and/or launching software products, and software design and architecture Experience with front-end frameworks, full-stack development, and/or API development Excellent communication skills. You can validate your decisions and communicate them clearly Comfortable exploring solutions to complex problems and working collaboratively to pave the way forward in new problem spaces The ability to mentor and inspire senior and junior developers Bonus points for:We value a variety of voices. You don‚Äôt need to check every box on this list to apply. PythoDjango experience Experience collaborating with geographically distributed team members Previous experience working in open source Experience with security in front-end and back-end tech stacks About Mozilla Mozilla exists to build the Internet as a public resource accessible to all because we believe that open and free is better than closed and controlled. When you work at Mozilla, you give yourself a chance to make a difference in the lives of Web users everywhere. And you give us a chance to make a difference in your life every single day. Join us to work on the Web as the platform and help create more opportunity and innovation for everyone online.Commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and belongingMozilla understands that valuing diverse creative practices and forms of knowledge are crucial to and enrich the company‚Äôs core mission. We encourage applications from everyone, including members of all equity-seeking communities, such as (but certainly not limited to) women, racialized and Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, persons of all sexual orientations, gender identities, and expressions.We will ensure that qualified individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, as appropriate. Please contact us at email protected to request accommodation.We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race (including hairstyle and texture), religion (including religious grooming and dress practices), gender, gender identity, gender expression, color, national origin, pregnancy, ancestry, domestic partner status, disability, sexual orientation, age, genetic predisposition, medical condition, marital status, citizenship status, military or veteran status, or any other basis covered by applicable laws. Mozilla will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics or any other unlawful behavior, conduct, or purpose.Group: CReq ID: R2158

title: Contact Center Senior Manager
description: About us: We‚Äôre on a mission to fundamentally transform mental healthcare accessibility. Grow Therapy empowers therapists to launch and grow thriving insurance-accepting private practices. We‚Äôre creating game-changing technology to build America‚Äôs biggest behavioral healthcare group and ensure that anyone can afford quality mental healthcare. Following the mass increase in depression and anxiety, the need for accessibility is more important than ever. To make our vision for mental healthcare a reality, we‚Äôre building a team of entrepreneurs and mission-driven go-getters. Our founders come from Harvard Medical School, Stripe, and Blackstone, and are champions of balancing bold ambitions with a culture that promotes holistic well-being. Since launching in 2020, Grow has raised over $90M from top VCs and angel investors, including TCV, Transformation Capital, SignalFire, Village Global, CoFound, and leaders of Oscar, Nurx, Quartet, Airbnb, and Blackstone. What You‚Äôll Be Doing: We are looking for an organized, strategic thinker excited to elevate our Contact Center performance through process (Call/Text/Chat) and staffing optimizations. You‚Äôll focus on improving our conversion and helping us invest in the right system to run a high quality Contact Center as we scale. In this role, you‚Äôll hire, support and motivate your team to make sure they‚Äôre on track to meet company goals. You‚Äôll work to create an organization that can support our agents and respond to customer escalation while ensuring quality customer experience and increased bookings.Some of the first projects you‚Äôll tackle: Evaluating channel performance and create agent level dashboards to improve employee management Running experiments to improve our call scripting and channel / medium mix Maintaining and reporting metrics on overall and agent level performance, including: bookings, efficiency, and quality Improving our scheduling models to handle high and low volume times in order to increase booking efficiency Projecting hiring needs and thinking through organizational design Manage multiple, complex, on‚Äêgoing tasks and projects while monitoring absence and attendance of your team Working cross functionally, especially with the Growth Team to ensure we are investing in the right sources and channels Salary range: $121,125 - $177,375You‚Äôll Be a Good Fit If: You have 5+ years of full-time professional experience working in a call center that was responsible for generating revenue and/or closing deals You have a keen eye for detail and understand how minute data points aggregate into trends You are comfortable analyzing user data to recommend process improvements You have strong opinions on how different mediums (text, call, chat, email) can serve different channels to improve conversion You have ‚Äúseen the show‚Äù in what it takes to manage and scale a successful contact center and are excited to build If you don‚Äôt meet every single requirement, but are still interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and Grow believes the perfect candidate is more than just a resume. Note: Please upload your resume in PDF format Benefits The chance to drive impact within the mental healthcare landscape from day one Comprehensive health insurance plans, including dental and vision Our dedication to mental health guides our culture. Wellness benefits include (but are not limited to): Flexible working hours and location (remote OR in-office, your choice!) Generous PTO Company-wide winter break Mental health mornings (2 hours each week) Team meditation Wellness Stipend In-office lunch and biweekly remote lunch on us! Continuous learning opportunities Competitive salary The opportunity to help build a rapidly scaling start-up organization by taking strong ownership of your work, mentorship, and our unbounded leadership opportunities

title: Salesforce Developer / Administrator
description: Who we are Samsara (NYSE: IOT) is the pioneer of the Connected Operations‚Ñ¢ Cloud, which is a platform that enables organizations that depend on physical operations to harness Internet of Things (IoT) data to develop actionable insights and improve their operations. At Samsara, we are helping improve the safety, efficiency and sustainability of the physical operations that power our global economy. Representing more than 40% of global GDP, these industries are the infrastructure of our planet, including agriculture, construction, field services, transportation, and manufacturing ‚Äî and we are excited to help digitally transform their operations at scale. Working at Samsara means you‚Äôll help define the future of physical operations and be on a team that‚Äôs shaping an exciting array of product solutions, including Video-Based Safety, Vehicle Telematics, Apps and Driver Workflows, Equipment Monitoring, and Site Visibility. As part of a recently public company, you‚Äôll have the autonomy and support to make an impact as we build for the long term. Recent awards we‚Äôve won include: Great Place To Work Certified‚Ñ¢ 2023 Best Place to Work by Built In 2023 Financial Times The Americas‚Äô Fastest Growing Companies 2023 Deloitte Fast 500 Companies IoT Analytics Company of the Year in 2022‚Äôs IoT Breakthrough Winners We see a profound opportunity for data to improve the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of operations, and hope you consider joining us on this exciting journey. About the role:The Salesforce Developer / Administrator will be responsible for the design and development of flexible and scalable solutions on the Salesforce and CPQ platforms. This role requires that you understand Salesforce development best practices and can apply them to the delivery of business solutions. The Developer will work with technical and cross-functional business teams to implement enhancements, projects, and resolve incidents, and requires a combination of analytical, technical, business acumen, and communication skills.You will develop tools to help scale our revenue-generating operations and increase sales efficiency. This is a multi-faceted role where you will work multi-functionally with our Sales, Customer Success, Product, Growth, Marketing, and Finance teams.This position is open to candidates who are interested in working remotely in the USA.You should apply if: You want to impact the industries that run our world: Your efforts will result in real-world impact‚Äîhelping to keep the lights on, get food into grocery stores, reduce emissions, and most importantly, ensure workers return home safely. You are the architect of your own career: If you put in the work, this role won‚Äôt be your last at Samsara. We set up our employees for success and have built a culture that encourages rapid career development, countless opportunities to experiment and master your craft in a hyper growth environment. You‚Äôre energized by our opportunity: The vision we have to digitize large sectors of the global economy requires your full focus and best efforts to bring forth creative, ambitious ideas for our customers. You want to be with the best: At Samsara, we win together, celebrate together and support each other. You will be surrounded by a high-caliber team that will encourage you to do your best. Click here to learn about what we value at Samsara. In this role, you will: Design and develop secure, scalable technical solutions on the Salesforce and CPQ platforms. Create and collaborate on the solution and technical design artifacts, and present and participate in cross-functional review sessions. Communicate technical solutions and design tradeoffs to Business Applications team members as well as business stakeholders. Provide technical support for new projects, enhancements, and bug fixes related to solutions being delivered on the Salesforce CPQ platform. Collaborate with Business system analysts to design implement end-to-end automation. Analyze business processes to identify inefficiencies and critical metrics. Evaluate existing code and develop plans to reduce technical debt over time and establish a technology roadmap with system architects. Maintain and optimize full lifecycle software development using standard configuration, Apex, VisualForce, LWC, APIs, CPQ, and Force.com applications. Coordinate and collaborate with other developers and team members to obtain requirements, develop solution design, manage UATs, and post-go-live activities. Champion, role model, and embed Samsara‚Äôs cultural principles (Focus on Customer Success, Build for the Long Term, Adopt a Growth Mindset, Be Inclusive, Win as a Team) as we scale globally and across new offices. Minimum requirements for the role: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or equivalent 2+ years in Salesforce development experience with knowledge of Sales Cloud, Apex, VisualForce, LWC, and Force.com tools and applications Experience in agile development methodology An ideal candidate also has: Familiarity with Salesforce CPQ functionality and features Working knowledge of Web and Javascript frameworks Web services experience preferred (REST, SOAP) Familiarity with Apex Enterprise Design Patterns Familiarity with integrated applications such as Mulesoft Experience with Python, with an emphasis on interacting with Salesforce APIs Experience in contributing to setting up CI/CD pipeline Certifications: Platform Developer, Platform App Builder, etc. Samsaras Compensation Philosophy: Samsaras compensation program is designed to deliver total compensation (based on role, level, and geography) that is above market. We do this through our base salary + bonus/variable + restricted stock unit awards (RSUs). A new hire RSU award is awarded at the time of hire, and additional RSU refresh grants may be awarded annually.We pay for performance, and top performers are eligible to receive above target equity refresh awards which allow employees to achieve higher market positioning. The range of annual base salary for full-time employees for this position is below. Please note that base pay offered may vary depending on factors including your city of residence, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. $93,500$137,500 USD At Samsara, we welcome everyone regardless of their background, race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, etc. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact. Accommodations Samsara is an inclusive work environment, and we are committed to ensuring equal opportunity in employment for qualified persons with disabilities. Please email email protected or click here if you require any reasonable accommodations throughout the recruiting process. Benefits Full time employees receive an above market total compensation package along with employee-led remote and flexible working, health benefits, Samsara for Good charity fund, and much, much more. Take a look at our Benefits site to learn more. Flexible Working At Samsara, we have adopted a flexible way of working, enabling teams and individuals to do their best work, regardless of where they‚Äôre based. We value in-person collaboration and know a change of scenery and quiet space to work is welcomed from time to time, but also appreciate that the world of work has changed. Our offices remain open for those who prefer to collaborate or work in-office, but we also encourage fully remote applicants. As most roles are not required to be in the office, we are able to hire remotely where Samsara has an established presence. If a role is required to be in a certain location and candidates do not have work authorization for that location, Samsara will conduct an immigration assessment. If the role is not required to be in a specific location, Samsara will move forward with the remote location that works best for the business. All offers of employment are contingent upon an individual‚Äôs ability to secure and maintain the legal right to work at the company. Please note: Samsara does not accept agency resumes and is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Samsara employees.

title: Field Sales Rep, Point of Banking (100% commission based)
description: At Flowhub, were about more than technology ‚Äî were on a mission to make legal cannabis accessible to everyone. Founded in 2015, Flowhub pioneered the first Metrc API integration to help dispensaries stay compliant. Today over 1,000 dispensaries trust Flowhubs point of sale, inventory management, business intelligence, and mobile solutions to process $3B+ cannabis sales annually.Flowhub is seeking a Field Sales Rep for our Point of Banking. This role is 100% commission based and will work as a 1099 contractor. Candidates must reside in Colorado, preferably the Denver area as this role will require in person visits to dispensaries. Job Responsibilities: Actively identify and pursue new business opportunities with the assigned territory by prospecting and qualifying leads. Develop a robust pipeline of potential customers and convert them into sales to achieve individual revenue targets. Gain a deep understanding of Flowhub‚Äôs Point of Banking system, and other software products and services, including their features, benefits, and competitive advantages. Effectively articulate these value propositions to potential clients, demonstrating how our solutions can enhance their operational efficiency and streamline business processes. Establish and matain strong relationships with key decision-makers in the cannabis industry, including dispensary owners, managers, and other relevant stakeholders. Cultivate a network of contacts through networking events, industry conferences, and other sales-driven activities. Take a consultative approach to understand the unique needs and challenges of potential clients. Provide tailored recommendations and solutions that align with their business objectives, showcasing Flowhub as a trusted and reliable partner. Conduct engaging and persuasive sales presentations and product demonstrations to showcase the value and capabilities of Flowhub‚Äôs Point of Banking software solutions. Own the entire sales cycle, from initial contact to closing the deal. Use a strategic and methodical approach to manage the sales process, including qualifying leads, negotiating contracts, and coordinating with internal teams to ensure successful implementation and customer satisfaction. Stay up-to-date with industry trends, regulations, and market dynamics that impact the cannabis industry. Leverage this knowledge to identify emerging opportunities, anticipate customer needs, and position Flowhub as a thought leader in the space. Who you are: Disciplined: Organized, process driven, structured and methodical with prospecting Relationship builder: Loves talking to people across all walks of life, easily relatable Challenger: Not afraid to challenge status quo: teaches, tailors, and takes control of a conversation Lead the Dance: Consultative and helps buyers navigate through new waters High Integrity: Does the right thing, even when no one is looking Mission Driven: Believes in our mission, and evangelizes to others Adaptable: Thrives in constantly changing environments and the industry develops Low-ego: Not afraid to make mistakes, high accountability, chill vibes Requirements: Minimum 2 years previous experience of successful field sales experience, preferably in the technology or software industry. Familiarity with the cannabis industry, including a solid understanding of dispensary operations, compliance requirements, and the unique challenges faced by cannabis businesses. A proactive and self-driven individual who thrives in a target-oriented environment. Must be comfortable working independently and managing time effectively to achieve sales goals. Exceptional interpersonal skills with a knack for building rapport and trust with clients. Proven ability to develop and maintain long-term customer relationships. Comfortable working with technology and software solutions. Experience with CRM systems, Salesforce preferred. Strong written and verbal communication skills Salary Range: $70,000 - $100,000 OTE

title: Vice President of Sales
description: Position Overview:We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Part-Time Vice President of Sales. As the Vice President of Sales, you will be responsible for driving revenue growth, developing and implementing sales strategies, and leading the sales team to achieve targets. This part-time position offers flexible hours and requires strong leadership skills, a proven sales track record, and a deep understanding of the sales process.Responsibilities: Sales Strategy and Planning: Collaborate with the executive team to develop sales strategies, goals, and targets that align with the companys overall objectives. Conduct market research and analysis to identify potential growth opportunities and drive strategic decision-making. Team Leadership and Management: Build and lead a high-performing sales team. Recruit, train, and mentor sales representatives, providing guidance, support, and performance coaching. Foster a collaborative and results-oriented culture within the sales department. Sales Process Optimization: Analyze and refine the sales process, identifying areas for improvement and implementing strategies to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. Develop and maintain sales playbooks, standard operating procedures, and sales training programs. Sales Performance and Metrics: Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and sales metrics to measure individual and team performance. Monitor sales performance, track progress against targets, and implement corrective actions as needed. Provide regular reporting and insights to the executive team. Customer Relationship Management: Nurture and maintain relationships with key clients and strategic partners. Collaborate with the marketing team to align sales and marketing efforts, ensuring a seamless customer experience throughout the sales process. Sales Forecasting and Budgeting: Collaborate with the finance team to develop sales forecasts, budgets, and sales compensation plans. Monitor sales expenses and optimize resource allocation to maximize return on investment. Market Analysis and Competitive Intelligence: Stay informed about market trends, competitor activities, and industry developments. Conduct regular market analysis and gather competitive intelligence to identify opportunities and maintain a competitive edge. Sales Enablement: Collaborate with marketing and product teams to provide sales collateral, tools, and resources that support the sales process. Ensure sales representatives are equipped with the necessary knowledge and materials to effectively communicate the value proposition to customers. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in business, marketing, or a related field. MBA is a plus. Proven track record of success in sales leadership roles, preferably within a similar industry. Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills, with the ability to develop and execute sales strategies that drive revenue growth. Exceptional leadership and team management abilities, with a track record of building and motivating high-performing sales teams. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to negotiate and influence effectively at all levels. Proficiency in sales management software and customer relationship management (CRM) systems. Strong business acumen and understanding of market dynamics and customer behavior. Results-driven mindset with a focus on exceeding targets and delivering measurable outcomes. Flexibility and adaptability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. As a part-time Vice President of Sales, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on sales performance while enjoying flexibility in your work schedule. If you are a dynamic sales leader, passionate about driving revenue growth and motivating a high-performing sales team, we encourage you to apply.
